meanings.definition: A person or thing that interrupts or stops the flow or progress of something.
meanings.sent1: The intermitters in the meeting kept disrupting the speaker.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights act as intermitters to control the flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The intermitters, like mischievous elves, caused chaos in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden arrival was an intermitters in the calm of the evening.
meanings.sent5: The intermitters, like stubborn rocks in a river, blocked any progress.

meanings.definition: To temporarily suspend or stop something from continuing.
meanings.sent1: Please intermitters the movie for a moment while I take this call.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to intermitters the lesson due to a fire drill.
meanings.sent3: He intermitters his workout to grab a quick snack.
meanings.sent4: The storm intermitters the outdoor event abruptly.
meanings.sent5: She intermitters her speech to emphasize a key point.

meanings.definition: The act of temporarily pausing or halting something.
meanings.sent1: The intermitters of the game surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: A brief intermitters in the music added suspense to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The intermitters of the clock made the meeting feel longer.
meanings.sent4: The intermitters of the rain delayed the start of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: His intermitters of the conversation allowed for a moment of reflection.
